chav1961.purelib.basic

Class AssemblerTemplateRepo

  • java.lang.Object
    • chav1961.purelib.basic.AssemblerTemplateRepo
  • Deprecated.

    @Deprecated
public class AssemblerTemplateRepo
extends Object

    This class is used to simplify assembly code generation (see AsmWriter). It is an alternative mechanism for assembler code automation against assembler macros. Don't use it in your applications, use macros instead of it.

    Base of the class is a template repository. Template repository contains a set of parts. Every part is a piece of the input stream was passed in the class constructor. Example of the parts is:

    {part1} ----
    <content of the part1>
    <. . .>
    {part2} ----
    <content of the part2>
    <. . .>
    {partN} ----
    <content of the partN>
    <. . .>

    content of the part is an ordinal assembler code fragment. Is can also contains any substitutions in the SubstitutableProperties-styled syntax. When you wish to insert the part requested in the assembler code, simply call append(GrowableCharArray, char[]) or #append(GrowableCharArray, char[], CharSubstitutionSource) method. The class instance seek the part requested, performs any substitutions in it and put target content into the GrowableCharArray instance.

    To simplify substitution process, a public inner class AssemblerTemplateRepo.NameKeeper can be used. To get access to the class instance, simply call getNameKeeper() instance. You can then put any key/value pairs in it to use in the substitution process. The class has also a specific method AssemblerTemplateRepo.NameKeeper.push() to organize substitution hierarchy (for example, in the recursive code generators). Typical use of the AssemblerTemplateRepo.NameKeeper class is:

    public void parse(...,AssemblerTemplateRepo repo,NameKeeper parent,GrowableCharArray writer...) {
     try(NameKeeper current = parent.push()) {
      . . .
      current.put("NAME1",value1).put("NAME2",value2)...
      . . .
      repo.append(writer,"PARTNAME".toCharArray(),current);
      . . .
     }
    }

    The AssemblerTemplateRepo.NameKeeper class searches the name required in it's instance. If the name not found, it continues searching in the parent instance.

    Since:
    0.0.2
    Author:
    Alexander Chernomyrdin aka chav1961
    See Also:
    MacroCompilerTest, JUnit tests
